A Democrat , he formerly represented the 14th district in the New York City Council , including the neighborhoods of Claremont Village, Fordham , Kingsbridge , Marble Hill , Morris Heights , Mount Eden, Mount Hope , and University Heights . Cabrera is a socially conservative Democrat. He is an opponent of abortion and opposes same-sex marriage . [ 1 ] [ ] Early life and education [ edit ] [ edit ] Cabrera was born in the Bronx to a Dominican father and Puerto Rican mother. He received a B.A. in Religion from Southern California College , a M.A. in Counseling from Liberty University , and a Doctorate in Education from Argosy University . [ 2 ] [ ] Career [ edit ] [ edit ] In 2009, Cabrera challenged Maria Baez to a primary election for the Democratic nomination for 14th district in the Bronx. With the backing of The Bronx Democratic Committee [ 3 ] and the endorsement of key unions, Cabrera was able to defeat the incumbent by just over 1% difference in three-way race that included Yudelka Tapia . [ 4 ] Cabrera followed that by winning the general election against Republican Yessenia A. Duran and Conservative Lisa Marie Campbell. [ 5 ] He won reelection in 2013. [ ] [ ] [ ] In 2014, Cabrera challenged Senator Gustavo Rivera in the Democratic primary, but lost 59% to 41%. During his primary bid against Rivera, Cabrera attracted ire for his opposition to abortion & gay marriage, as well as his apparent praise of an anti-gay Ugandan law. [ 6 ] In a video posted on Youtube and later deleted, Cabrera, speaking from Uganda, said, "Gay marriage is not accepted in this country. Why? Because the Christians have assumed the place of decision-making for the nation." [ 7 ] [ ] [ ] Cabrera challenged Rivera again in 2016, [ 8 ] but lost by a larger margin, 63% to 37%. [ 9 ] [ ] [ ] On September 12, 2017, Cabrera won 55% of the vote in the New York Democratic Primary election , to 35% for challenger Randy Abreu and 10% for Felix Perdomo. On January 11, 2018, Cabrera was elected Majority Whip and Chairman of the Committee on Governmental Operations. [ 10 ] [ ] In 2019, Cabrera announced that he was going to challenge Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in the Democratic primary for New York's 14th congressional district , while criticizing her embracing of democratic socialism . [ 11 ] On March 1, 2020, Cabrera announced that he was ending his primary bid against Ocasio-Cortez

and that he would instead be running for the position of Bronx Borough President in 2021. [ 12 ] [ ] [ ] Cabrera lost this borough president race to Vanessa Gibson , the then-chair of the council's Committee on Public Safety. She is the first woman to hold the position of Bronx borough president. [ 13 ] [ ] In February 2022, after New York City mayor Eric Adams named Cabrera a senior advisor in the city's Office of Faith-Based and Community Partnerships, LGBT groups objected to the appointment, citing Cabrera's history of opposing same-sex marriage. [ 7 ] [ ] 2009 Democratic primary √ Fernando Cabrera 38.53% Maria Baez 37.16% Yudelka Tapia 24.31% 2009 General √ Fernando Cabrera (D) 87.58% Yessenia A. Duran (R) 10.59% Lisa Marie Campbell (Conservative) 1.83% 2013 Democratic primary √ Fernando Cabrera 74.83% Israel Martinez 25.18% 2013 General √ Fernando Cabrera (D) 95.36% Stanley Butler (R) 3.50% Alan H. Reed (Conservative) 1.05% 2014 Democratic primary √ Gustavo Rivera 59.31% Fernando Cabrera 40.70% 2016 Democratic primary √ Gustavo Rivera 62.97% Fernando Cabrera 37.93% 2017 Democratic primary √ Fernando Cabrera 55.06% Randy Abreu 34.69% Felix Perdomo 10.03% 2017 General √ Fernando Cabrera (D) 83.67% Randy Abreu (Working Families) 10.41% Alan Reed (R) 4.36% Justin Sanchez (Liberal) 1.51% Personal life [ edit ] [ edit ] Cabrera is the senior pastor of New Life Outreach International in the Kingsbridge area of the Bronx. He is a former program director for the Mental Health and Counseling program at Mercy College . [ 2 ] [ ] References [ edit ] [ edit ] ^ a_henning (2019-10-10). Player signed August 23, 1999. August 13, 2007: Selected off waivers by the Tampa Bay Devil Rays from the Cleveland Indians . August 18, 2007: Granted Free Agency. August 21, 2007: Signed as a Free Agent with the Baltimore Orioles . September 5, 2008: Released by the Baltimore Orioles . January 27, 2009: Signed as a Free Agent with the Boston Red Sox . November 11, 2009: Granted Free Agency. December 4, 2009: Signed as a Free Agent with the Boston Red Sox . October 5, 2010: Granted Free Agency. December 17, 2010: Signed as a Free Agent with the Oakland Athletics . November 2, 2011: Granted Free Agency. January 10, 2012: Signed as a Free Agent with the New York Mets . November 3, 2012: Granted Free Agency. January 12, 2013: Signed as a Free Agent with the Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim . November 5, 2013: Granted Free Agency. February 11, 2015: Signed as a Free Agent with the San Francisco Giants . April 2, 2015: Released by the San Francisco Giants . German: Fernando Cabrera Statistik Japanese: フェルナンド・カブレラ 成績 Chinese: 费尔南多·卡布雷拉 數據 Frequently Asked Questions How old is Fernando Cabrera? Fernando Cabrera is 43 years old. When was Fernando Cabrera born? Fernando Cabrera was born on November 16, 1981. Where was Fernando Cabrera born? Fernando Cabrera was born in Toa Baja, Puerto Rico . How tall is Fernando Cabrera? Fernando Cabrera is 6-4 (193 cm) tall. How much did Fernando Cabrera weigh when playing? Fernando Cabrera weighed 225 lbs (102 kg) when playing. How many seasons did Fernando Cabrera play? Fernando Cabrera played 7 seasons. Is Fernando Cabrera in the Hall of Fame? Fernando Cabrera has not been elected into the Hall of Fame. When was Fernando Cabrera drafted? Fernando Cabrera was drafted by the Cleveland Indians in the 10th round of the 1999 MLB June Amateur Draft from Academia Discipulos de Cristo (Bayamon, Puerto Rico) . What position did Fernando Cabrera play? Fernando Cabrera was a Pitcher. How many strikeouts did Fernando Cabrera have? Fernando Cabrera had 193 strikeouts over his career. How many teams has Fernando Cabrera played for? Fernando Cabrera played for 3 teams; the Baltimore Orioles, Boston Red Sox and Cleveland Indians. When did Fernando Cabrera retire? Fernando Cabrera last played in 2010. Other Resources & Links
